title: Bury St Edmunds
summary: Bury St Edmunds (/ˈbɛri/), commonly referred to locally as Bury, is a historic market, cathedral town and civil parish in Suffolk, England.[2] Bury St Edmunds Abbey is near the town centre. Bury is the seat of the Diocese of St Edmundsbury and Ipswich of the Church of England, with the episcopal see at St Edmundsbury Cathedral.
